ASV path planner package

ROS node module

This is the ROS script to use the MARUS simulator and test the collision avoidance algorithm

class asv_path_planner.ros_script.RosScriptNode[source]

Bases: Node

This class defines the ROS node which is used to connect to the MARUS simulator

Target Ship (TS) module

Module for target ships (TS)/obstacles consisting of one class

class asv_path_planner.ts_class.TS(length)[source]

Bases: object

Class that stores information about TS/obstacles:

  • Position

  • Length

  • Width

  • Speed

  • Orientation

and other that are stored during the collision avoidance algorithm.

Velocity Obstacle (VO) module

class asv_path_planner.velobst_class.VO(leng_OS, width_OS, max_speedOS, max_time_col, treshhold, safe_domain_fact, speed_unc, ang_unc, speed_res, ang_res)[source]

Bases: object

add_uncert(vel_obst, posTS_rel, vel_TS)[source]

Function to add the uncertainties in speed and angle of the TS to the VO

Function to calculate the angle between two vectors

Function to calculate the angle between two angles (+-180°)

calc_abs_vel(ref_vel, targ_vel)[source]

Function to calculate the absolute velocity of the TS if only the relative velocity of TS is given; Returns the absolute velocity of the target ship with speed and angle

calc_ang_n_to_e(angle)[source]

Function that converts the angle from the north clockwise system to the east counter clockwise system and vice versa

calc_ang_vect(vel_OS, vel_Rel)[source]

Function to calulate the angle between the two velocity vectors

calc_colreg_con(vel_TS_xy, pos_TS_rel, colr_rule)[source]

Function to calculate the COLREG constrains

calc_coord_gps_to_xy(coord_os, coord_ts)[source]

Function to calc GPS coordinates to xy-coordinates in meters to the OS; Returns the position of the target ship relative to the own ship in the xy- coordinate system

calc_free_vel_space(velobs, vel_space_free)[source]

Calculate all velocities that are free of collision

Parameters:

  • velobs (velocity obstacle or colreg contrains) –

  • vel_space_free (all possible velocities of the OS) –

Returns:

  • vel_space_free (free velocities)

  • in_all (all velocities inside the VO)

Function of the minkoswski sum

Function to calculate the new velocity for encounters, where no COLREG constrains are applied

Function Check for Collision

check_colreg_rule_heading(vel_OS_2, vel_TS_2)[source]

Function to check COLREG rule (angle between vel_OS and vel_TS heading// course over ground)

check_side(vel_Rel, tang_coord)[source]

Function that checks wether the relative velocity is inside the CC or outside, if outside check which side

extract_most_common_vel(arr, threshold)[source]

Function to calculate the most common velocity

inOutVO(v_test, vo)[source]

Calculation of all point inside or outside the velocity obstacle :param v_test: :type v_test: Velocity points to test :param vo: :type vo: velocity obstacle vertices

Returns:

  • v_outn (all points outside the VO)

  • v_test (all points inside the VO)

orientation(v1, v2, p)[source]

Calculation of all points that are right or left of a directed vector :param v1: :type v1: Vertex 1 of the velocity obstacle. :param v2: :type v2: Vertex 2 of the velocity obstacle. :param p: :type p: Points that are tested

Returns:

  • v_out (all points left from the vector formed by v1, v2)

  • v_in (all points left from the vector formed by v1, v2)

vect_to_ang_mag(vect_xy)[source]

Function that calculates the magnitude and direction of a vector given in x/y-form

vect_to_xy(vector)[source]

Function that calculates the x/y-form of a vector given in magnitude/direction-form

w_2 = 1.3
